WorkItem.ClosedComment: Rawr 4.0.17 Released. If this is still an issue in this new version, please reopen the issue per the Posting Guidelines with all of the necessary information.
WorkItem.Description:
ProtWarr gave me an incorrect damage reduction from armor. I noticed this model uses StatConversion.GetArmorDamageReduction to calculate the damage reduction. But GetArmorDamageReduction is using an old formula:
ArmorConstant = 400 + 85 * TargetLevel + 4.5f * 85 * (TargetLevel - 59) 
the simplified version of this formula is:
WotLK	ArmorConstant = Armor / (Armor + MobLevel * 467.5 - 22167.5)
Â 
The new formula for the current expansion is:
Cata	ArmorConstant = Armor / (Armor + MobLevel * 2167.5 - 158167.5)
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Incorrect formula for damage reduction from armor

Comments.Message: Not at a computer to check but right now, but are you sure that's in use in the Rawr4 copy of StatConversion? We've had a ton of false reports lately, due to people looking at old code.

The Rawr4 version of the file is using:
ArmorConstant = 400 + 85 * TargetLevel + 4.5f * 85 * (TargetLevel - 59)
Marking this as fixed unless someone can prove it wrong
